@description.name: @description
@description.body:
*****************************************************************

qooxdoo - the new era of web development http://qooxdoo.org Copyright: 2004-2008 1&1 Internet AG, Germany, http://www.1und1.de License: MIT: https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT See the LICENSE file in the project's top-level directory for details. Authors: Fabian Jakobs (fjakobs) *

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The desktop is a widget, which can act as container for windows. It can be used to define a clipping region for internal windows e.g. to create an MDI like application.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
windowManager {qx.ui.window.IWindowManager} The window manager to use for the desktop.
    If not provided, an instance of {@link qx.ui.window.Window#DEFAULT_MANAGER_CLASS} is used.
@param.description:
The window manager to use for the desktop.
    If not provided, an instance of {@link qx.ui.window.Window#DEFAULT_MANAGER_CLASS} is used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the desktop's window manager

@param.name: @param
@param.body: manager {qx.ui.window.IWindowManager} The window manager

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a list of all windows added to the desktop (including hidden windows)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the configured layout supports a maximized window e.g. is a Canvas.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether the layout supports maximized windows
@return.description: Whether the layout supports maximized windows

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Block direct child widgets with a zIndex below zIndex

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
zIndex {Integer} All child widgets with a zIndex below this value
     will be blocked
@param.description:
All child widgets with a zIndex below this value
     will be blocked

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget is currently blocked

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.description:
The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.description: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given widget if it is a child widget. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.Widget} the widget to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given widget is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child widget at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the widget will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a widget before another already inserted widget This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget before the new widget will be inserted.
@param.description: Widget before the new widget will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a widget after another already inserted widget This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} Widget, after which the new widget will be inserted
@param.description: Widget, after which the new widget will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the widget to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the widget at the specified index. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the widget to remove.
@param.description: Index of the widget to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array of the removed children.
@return.description: An array of the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the desktop's window manager. Each desktop must have a window manager. If none is configured the default window manager {@link qx.ui.window.Window#DEFAULTMANAGERCLASS} is used.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler. Called if one of the managed windows changes its active state.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Event} the event object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Event handler. Called if one of the managed windows changes its modality

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Event} the event object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Overrides the method {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#_afterAddChild}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: win {qx.ui.core.Widget} added widget

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles the case, when a window is added to the desktop.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: win {qx.ui.window.Window} Window, which has been added

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Overrides the method {@link qx.ui.core.Widget#_afterRemoveChild}

@param.name: @param
@param.body: win {qx.ui.core.Widget} removed widget

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handles the case, when a window is removed from the desktop.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: win {qx.ui.window.Window} Window, which has been removed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property activeWindow. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activeWindow}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property activeWindow. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activeWindow}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property activeWindow. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #activeWindow}.
